title: Helping Others Improve, EP 13

embed.description: This is part of a series, where I try and help others go from Bronze to silver. Heck maybe even gold. Im not the one playing, Im spectating a game. If you are bronze and want some help, let me know.

body:
NO MORE BLACK BORDERS.
BECAUSE I GOT OFF MY ASS AND MADE IT PROPER!
lol

replies.body: About bloody time.  Been waiting for ever.. do more of these and less of that orlia thingy you do

Sorry XD
I do ori because its fun and it helps me work on my solo commentary.
And this takes awhile as I have to wait for the other guy, 
Sorry that they take so long to be up :(

ADSL 1 doesn't help either.

You best be sorry. I had to spend like a whole minute searching for similar videos XD. . I want  to be compensated.
Haven't watched the ori stuff.  Only enjoy lol things

Each to their own.
I got some (Very few) who enjoyed my suffering as I played LIMBO.
now they are enjoying it in Ori.

The reason I'm not too concerned about my CS against a Zed early on is because I know if I try to play aggressively, he'll be able to either push me out of lane, or get a solid gank off on me.  I also know that I'm a lot more accomplished at keeping my CS rising steadily, instead of forgetting about it mid-game.

That third gank down bot I was short mana for the ult. I noticed it just as I dropped below 'enough' so I turned off W and moved off a bit. When I got it back, I went for the kill on ez.

Trying to CS too much with your W will drain your mana really quickly early on. Aurelion is not a strong early game champion, and Zed can push him out of lane so easily. It's not until I finish my rylai's that I'm able to actually try to be more aggressive.

The reason I went rylai's and liandries before zhonyas is because of the synergy between them and my W. It's extremely safe AOE poke. Zhonyas is also a massive bait for such an immobile champion as Aurelion. The second you zhonyas, you've just signed your own death warrant(unless you're only using it for zed's ult after you've already reached safety).

By rushing something like a tear, you sacrifice survivability. Aurelion has no innate escape so you need to build him tankier(like a non-suicide karthas, or a cho'gath)

I started backing around 26m when the fight happened because I didn't want the team to go into that fight. The ping was from me, and I believed we would lose that.

I've also noticed that you assume a lot of stuff(like that I know it's safe to stick around in certain parts, when you can see there's no enemies nearby, but I can't). You have to remember, in the real game, there's a fog of war.

We didn't baron because we were too low. We took mid tower because they were all dead and there was no real danger, despite us being low.

That death to Zac at 29-30m was embarrassing. Had to skip that. :(

One key mistake you make is assuming Aurelion is a burst champion. Aurelion is a sustained DPS mage bruiser. He relies heavily on his W to poke and deal damage in teamfights.

Still watching, will update as I go.

Over all you did extremely well.
The whole point of this really is to be a constant reminder of "Dont forget to ward and remember to upgrade trinket"
Jonius and Fits use this to watch all there mistakes so they wont do them again.

Its mainly here so you can also see, what you did right (The roams were awesome)
and what you could have done better. (Pinks, upgraded trinket, warding etc)
Nice! Improves the video quality a whole lot!
